result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffery P. Hoppe

records.addlTxt:
3:21 p.m.
Clerk Micki. 
INCLUDES 22CF419, 22CF713, and 22CF1024.

State appears by ADA Sidney Brubacher; Defendant appears in person in custody from the MCJ, with Attorney Anne Renc.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed. 
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

State moves to: 
22CF713
COUNT 1: Bail Jumping - Felony >> DRI.
COUNT 2: Resisting or Obstructing an Officer >> DRI.
22CF1024
COUNT 1: Bail Jumping - Felony >> DRI.
COUNT 2: Bail Jumping - Felony >> DRI.

COURT GRANTS.

PLEA to: 
22CF419
COUNT 1: OWI (5th) >> NO CONTEST. 

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: 4.5 years WPS (1.5 years IC; 3 years ES), with credit for 49 days credit. Conditions of ES: $600.00 fine plus court costs; Any vehicle titled or registered in the Defendant's name is subject to IID installation for 3 years; 1/2 price cost of IID; 3 years DL revocation with any administrative credit; Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; AODA and f/u; 6pts; Absolute sobriety from alcohol; No driving w/o a valid driver's license; and DNA sample and surcharge. Eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

ADJ: 3:40 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 6, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

Review hearing on August 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary Hearing on August 29, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 22, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Plea hearing on November 8, 2022 at 10:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Jeffery P. Hoppe
Current: 1240 Merrill Avenue Apt 5, Wausau, WI 54401   (Effective: 06-14-2022)
Prior: 1240 Merrill Avenue #330, Wausau, WI 54401
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 8, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 20, 2022 at 03:10 pm.

records.addlTxt:
2:37 PM 
Clerk: Amy. 

State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen.   Defendant appears in custody by video from MCJ with Atty Peter Vu. 

Date and time set for initial appearance. 
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Prelim Time Limits Waived. 

COURT ORDERS: $2500.00 signature bond.  

CONDITIONS: 
- No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol. 
- Prints and photograph. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.  

IH:  6/20/22 at 9:30 a.m., Branch 5. 
JPTC:  7/01/22 at 10:00 a.m.
